thread.title: Chelsea vs Manchester United early team news revealed as Jose Mourinho prepares to return to Stamford Bridge
thread.title_full: Chelsea vs Manchester United early team news revealed as Jose Mourinho prepares to return to Stamford Bridge

author: mirror
title: Chelsea vs Manchester United early team news revealed as Jose Mourinho prepares to return to Stamford Bridge
text:
Sport Chelsea vs Manchester United early team news revealed as Jose Mourinho prepares to return to Stamford Bridge Mourinho admitted the trip south will be "hard" without his top scorer, especially considering his squad only arrived back from Russia on Friday morning Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Antonio Conte gives major update on John Terry's future at Chelsea Share this video Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jose Mourinho returns to Stamford Bridge on Monday and will do so without star man Zlatan Ibrahimovic. 
Ibrahimovic was banned for three games for elbowing Tyrone Mings during Manchester United's 1-1 draw with Bournemouth. 
Wayne Rooney and Luke Shaw come back into contention, however, as does Eric Bailly after serving a European suspension in Russia, where United emerged unscathed despite concerns over the pitch. Bastian Schweinsteiger remains a doubt with an unspecified complaint. 
Mourinho admitted the trip south will be "hard" without his top scorer, especially considering his squad only arrived back from Russia on Friday morning. 
Speaking ahead of the game, Mourinho said: "We have to go to London. It’s really hard. We don’t have Zlatan, of course not, but we go with everything we have. We don’t put a [weakened] team out like some clubs sometimes - Manchester United cannot do that. Jose Mourinho and Antonio Conte in October (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) 
"We know this Europa League is very important for us, and the FA Cup is beautiful. We cannot go there with a [Reserve] team, we'll try to manage it within our squad and get a good team to compete with them. 
"Manchester United is Manchester United; it's the winner of this competition. It's not Chelsea's fault we were given this Monday match. We'll make changes, as we played on Thursday, but we cannot go to Chelsea with a [Reserve] team." 
Chelsea head coach Antonio Conte, meanwhile, has a fully-fit squad and is considering his options for Monday's FA Cup quarter-final. 
John Terry has played in the three prior FA Cup rounds, but the defender's place against United is not guaranteed. 
And with Chelsea next in action at Stoke five days later, Conte could field his first-choice line-up against United. 
Provisional Chelsea squad: Courtois, Begovic, Fabregas, Zouma, Alonso, Kante, Hazard, Loftus-Cheek, Moses, Pedro, Costa, Matic, Willian, Batshuayi, Cahill, Terry, Azpilicueta, Chalobah, Luiz, Eduardo, Aina, Ake. 
Provisional United Squad: De Gea, Romero, O'Hara, Valencia, Jones, Rojo, Smalling, Bailly, Blind, Darmian, Shaw, Young, Carrick, Herrera, Fellaini, Schweinsteiger, Pogba, Mata, Lingard, Mkhitaryan, Martial, Rooney, Rashford. Like us on Facebook
